title: Metropolis Monte Carlo sampling: convergence, localization transition and optimality. (arXiv:2207.10488v4 [cond-mat.stat-mech] UPDATED)
abstract: Among random sampling methods, Markov Chain Monte Carlo algorithms are foremost. Using a combination of analytical and numerical approaches, we study their convergence properties towards the steady state, within a random walk Metropolis scheme. Analysing the relaxation properties of some model algorithms sufficiently simple to enable analytic progress, we show that the deviations from the target steady-state distribution can feature a localization transition as a function of the characteristic length of the attempted jumps defining the random walk.
